means: （有时不受欢迎或未受邀请而）参加

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"连接，结合，联合"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: join, combine, unite, connect, link, attach, couple, associate, relate
means: join ： 侧重把原来不相连接的物紧密地连接在一起，但仍可再分开。也指把分散的人或几个部分的人联合起来，或加入到某团体中去。
combine ： 指两个或两个以上的人或物结合在一起。
unite ： 指联合、团结、结合在一起，构成一个整体。
connect ： 指两事物在某一点上相连接，但彼此又保持独立。
link ： 指连环式的连接，或用接合物或其它方式连接，还可指一事物与另一事物的联系或关系。
attach ： 指把局部连接在整体上，小的接在大的上面，活动的接在固定的上面。
couple ： 专指连接两件东西，或把事物成对进行连接。
associate ： 指人与人友好和平、平等地联合在一起；用于物时，指两事物因历史或其它原因，很自然被人们联系在一起，即产生联想。
relate ： 指人与人有亲戚或婚烟关系；也指人或物之间尚存的实际或假想的联系。

sentence.Network_en: He said they would attach conditions to the handover of the base.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说他们将对基地的移交附加一些条件。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'seize by legal authority'): from Old French atachier or estachier 'fasten, fix', based on an element of Germanic origin related to stake; compare with attack

encyclopedia.content: 英文解释及物动词 vt. 1.装上，贴上，系上[(+to)] He'll attach the label to your luggage. 他会把标签系在你的行李上。 2.使依附；使附属[(+to)] This hospital is attached to the medical college nearby. 这个医院附属附近的那所医学院。 3.锛堄雘neself连用锛壥共渭樱皇垢阶臶(+to)] He attached himself to the expedition. 他参加了那个探险队。 4.【律】查封，扣押 5.把。..归于[(+to)] How can you attach the blame fo

entry.def: If you attach something to an object, you join it or fasten it to the object.

example.ex: We attach labels to things before we file them away...
example.tran: 存档前，我们先贴上标签。

example.ex: The gadget can be attached to any vertical surface...
example.tran: 这小玩意儿可以粘在任何垂直表面上。

entry.tran: （通常未受邀请而）加入，和…在一起，缠着
entry.def: If someone attaches himself or herself to you, they join you and stay with you, often without being invited to do so.

example.ex: Natasha attached herself to the film crew filming at her orphanage.
example.tran: 娜塔莎紧紧缠着在孤儿院拍摄电影的工作人员不放。

entry.def: If people attach a quality to someone or something, or if it attaches to them, people consider that they have that quality.

example.ex: The authorities attached much significance to his visit.
example.tran: 当局非常重视他的访问。

example.ex: ...the magic that still attaches to the word 'spy'.
example.tran: “间谍”一词依然具有的神奇魅力

entry.def: If you attach conditions to something such as an agreement, you state that specific things must be done before the agreement is valid.

example.ex: Activists are pressing the banks to attach political conditions to the signing of any new agreement...
example.tran: 激进分子强烈要求银行在签署任何新协议前要考虑政治条件。

example.ex: Magistrates will be able to attach conditions when juveniles are remanded.
example.tran: 地方法官将可以在少年犯送押时提出附加条件。

entry.def: In computing, if you attach a file to a message that you send to someone, you send it with the message but separate from it.

example.ex: It is possible to attach executable program files to e-mail.
example.tran: 可以在电子邮件里附上可执行程序文件。

Sentence.sentence: There are close to one million nerve fibres that connect the eyeball to the brain, as of yet it is impossible to attach them all in a new person.
They attach too much importance to public relations
Americans now attach more importance to the effective use of time.

If you say no, however, it may surprise you to learn that you are only unemployed if you've been actively looking for work in the past four weeks; otherwise, you are "marginally attached to the labor force" and not actually unemployed.

sentences.cn: 他在定货单上附了一张支票。

sentences.en: His new firm attached him to the sales division of the business.
sentences.cn: 他的新公司派他到营业部工作。

jushi.english: Part of his salary was attached by shopkeepers to whom he owed money.
jushi.chinese: 他的一部分薪水被扣下来偿还他所欠的店主的债。

jushi.english: If you owe money to a man, he may attach part of your salary unless you pay him.
jushi.chinese: 如果你欠某人的钱,他可以扣留你的部分薪金,除非你偿还他。
